title: Doflamingo's String Powers - Thread Puppet Theory
theoryText: Some fans theorized that Doflamingo's true ability isn't just manipulating people directly, but rather creating thread puppets that are very thin and transparent. This would explain how he can control people and cut through objects like Little Oars Jr.'s leg with such precision.
notes: Later episodes would confirm that Doflamingo's Ito Ito no Mi does allow him to create and manipulate strings for various purposes including cutting and controlling people.

title: Little Oars Jr.'s Survival and Moria's Plans
theoryText: After Little Oars Jr. was impaled by Gecko Moria's Tsuno-Tokage, fans theorized about whether he survived and if Moria would succeed in turning him into a zombie. Moria explicitly stated his anger at Doflamingo for 'damaging his future zombie,' indicating his intention to use Oars Jr.'s corpse.
notes: Little Oars Jr. survived his injuries and was later shown recovering after the war. Moria did not succeed in turning him into a zombie.

title: Wano Country Significance - Early Foreshadowing
theoryText: The mention of Ace learning to make a kasa in Wano Country led some attentive fans to theorize that Wano would become an important location in the future story. At the time of this episode (2010), Wano had only been briefly mentioned and wouldn't become central until nearly a decade later.
notes: Wano Country Arc began around episode 890 and became one of the longest and most important arcs in One Piece. This episode's mention of Wano in 2010 represents significant long-term foreshadowing.
